text.0: yon sun hath mounted up and this my happy fate hate mounted high.
text.1: i knowing this as conqueror have won my husband for mine own.
text.2: i am the banner and the head a mighty arbitress am i.
text.3: i am victorious and my lord shall be submissive to my will.
text.4: my sons are slayers of the foe my daughter is a ruling queen.
text.5: i am victorious oer my lord my song of triumph is supreme.
text.6: oblation that which indra gave and thus grew glorious and most high.
text.7: this have i offered o ye gods and rid me of each rival wife.
text.8: destroyer of the rival wife sole spouse victorious conqueror.
text.9: the others glory have i seized as twere the wealth of weaker dames.
text.10: i have subdued as conqueror these rivals these my fellowwives.
text.11: that i may hold imperial sway over this hero and the folk.
